cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 mi south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north-north-eastward across the northern Gulf, forecast to cross the Southeast U.S. (MS-AL-GA) and exit into the western Atlantic late Thursday–Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana near the Mississippi River Delta

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River LA to Navarre FL; Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle, then inland across MS-AL-GA and onward to the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated totals up to 6 inches cited by NHC)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤ tropical-storm-force) wind threat; peak 34-kt probability only 5%
weather_observation.storm_surge: No surge guidance issued for Georgia coastline; minimal coastal flooding expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain likely with locally higher amounts, producing risk of flash or urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible over GA on Thursday as the system moves inland
